title: Creates new date for payment of school taxes and repeals provisions of SCTA; repealer
summary: Refers to the Suffolk county tax act in relation to shifting the collection date for school taxes to October fifteenth over a five-year period; repeals certain provisions of such act.
fulltext:

       Introduced by M. of A. THIELE -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Real Property Taxation

       AN  ACT to amend the Suffolk county tax act, in relation to shifting the
         collection date for school taxes to October fifteenth over a five-year
         period and to repeal sections 7, 8, 9 and 10 of such act  relating  to
         the application of such act

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Sections 7, 8, 9, and 10 of chapter  311  of  the  laws  of
    2  1920, constituting the Suffolk county tax act are REPEALED.
    3    S  2.  Section 11 of chapter 311 of the laws of 1920, constituting the
    4  Suffolk county tax act, as amended by chapter 57 of the laws of 1948, is
    5  amended to read as follows:
    6    S 11. Extension of taxes by supervisor. The supervisor  of  each  town
    7  shall  on or before the [first day of December] FIFTEENTH DAY OF SEPTEM-
    8  BER IN THE YEAR TWO THOUSAND TWELVE AND ON OR BEFORE THE  FIRST  DAY  OF
    9  AUGUST  IN  ALL  SUCCEEDING  YEARS,  in  each year extend or cause to be
   10  extended upon the assessment roll of the town the taxes, assessments  or
   11  other  charges to be levied and assessed against the taxable persons and
   12  property on said roll as fixed and determined by the board  of  supervi-
   13  sors  or other competent authority; and the cost thereof shall be a town
   14  charge. Such extension shall be made in totals  or  items  as  shall  be
   15  requisite to conform to the form of the assessment roll as prescribed by
   16  the  board  of  supervisors as hereinbefore provided, and there shall be
   17  inserted in the roll a tabular statement of the total assessed valuation
   18  in each tax district, the amount of taxes and assessments to  be  raised
   19  and  the  tax rate therein. Such tabular statement shall also be printed
   20  or stamped in full upon the tax bills or on separate sheets as the board
   21  of supervisors may direct, and shall be distributed by the  receiver  to
   22  the taxpayers with the tax bills. In any town having one or more mechan-
   23  ical tax extension machines, the tax bills may be made by the supervisor

    3    S  3.  Section 12 of chapter 311 of the laws of 1920, constituting the
    4  Suffolk county tax act, as amended by chapter 908 of the laws  of  1962,
    5  is amended to read as follows:
    6    S  12. Filing certificate with board of supervisors. The supervisor of
    7  each town shall complete the extension of taxes and assessments upon the
    8  assessment roll and file with the board of supervisors on or before  the
    9  [first day of December] FIFTEENTH DAY OF SEPTEMBER IN THE YEAR TWO THOU-

   11  YEARS, in each year a certificate thereof in such form as the  board  of
   12  supervisors  may prescribe and furnish. Such assessment roll shall, when
   13  the warrant is annexed thereto, become the tax and  assessment  roll  of
   14  said town and of each school district and other tax districts therein.
   15    S 4. The opening paragraph of subdivision (a) of section 13 of chapter
   16  311  of  the  laws  of 1920, constituting the Suffolk county tax act, as
   17  amended by chapter 908 of the laws  of  1962,  is  amended  to  read  as
   18  follows:
   19    On or before the [first day of December] FIFTEENTH DAY OF SEPTEMBER IN
   20  THE  YEAR TWO THOUSAND TWELVE AND ON OR AFTER THE FIRST DAY OF AUGUST IN
   21  ALL SUCCEEDING YEARS, in each year or such date as may be designated  by
   22  a  resolution  of  the board of supervisors, the board of supervisors of
   23  the county shall cause to be annexed to the tax and assessment  roll  of
   24  each town a warrant under the seal of the county, signed by the chairman
   25  and  clerk of the board, commanding the receiver of taxes of the town to

   27  on the property named and described in the tax and assessment  roll  the
   28  several  sums  extended  therein  as  taxes  and assessments against the
   29  respective names and property, except taxes upon the shares of stock  of
   30  banks  and  banking  associations and further commanding him to pay over
   31  from time to time all moneys so collected, as follows:
   32    S 5. Sections 34, 35 and 78 of the Suffolk county tax act  are  renum-
   33  bered sections 84, 85 and 83, respectively, and a new article 3 is added
   34  to read as follows:
   35                                   ARTICLE 3
   36                          COLLECTION OF SCHOOL TAX
   37                               BY COLLECTIONS
   38    S  78.  PAYMENT  OF  SCHOOL  TAXES.  ALL SCHOOL TAXES SHALL BE PAYABLE
   39  ACCORDING TO THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE UNLESS PAYMENT IS MADE  PURSUANT  TO
   40  SECTION  SIXTY-NINE  OF THIS ACT: FOR THE TAX YEAR TWO THOUSAND THIRTEEN
   41  PAYMENTS SHALL BE MADE TO THE RECEIVER OF TAXES ON  OR  BEFORE  DECEMBER
   42  FIFTEENTH, FOR THE TAX YEAR TWO THOUSAND FOURTEEN PAYMENTS SHALL BE MADE
   43  TO  THE  RECEIVER  OF TAXES ON OR BEFORE NOVEMBER FIFTEENTH, FOR THE TAX
   44  YEAR TWO THOUSAND FIFTEEN PAYMENTS SHALL BE  MADE  TO  THE  RECEIVER  OF
   45  TAXES ON OR BEFORE NOVEMBER FIRST, FOR THE TAX YEAR TWO THOUSAND SIXTEEN
   46  PAYMENTS  SHALL  BE  MADE  TO THE RECEIVER OF TAXES ON OR BEFORE OCTOBER
   47  FIFTEENTH, FOR THE  TAX  YEAR  TWO  THOUSAND  SEVENTEEN  AND  ALL  YEARS
   48  SUCCEEDING  PAYMENTS SHALL BE MADE TO THE RECEIVER OF TAXES ON OR BEFORE
   49  OCTOBER FIRST.
   50    S 79. CERTIFICATION OF SCHOOL DISTRICTS. THE  BOARD  OF  ASSESSORS  OF
   51  EACH  TOWN  SHALL IMMEDIATELY UPON COMPLETING AND VERSIFYING THE ASSESS-
   52  MENT ROLL IN EACH YEAR ASCERTAIN THEREFROM THE TOTAL ASSESSED  VALUATION
   53  OF  THE  TAXABLE  PROPERTY  WITHIN EACH SCHOOL DISTRICT APPEARING ON THE
   54  ROLL, AND ON OR BEFORE AUGUST FIFTEENTH EACH YEAR SHALL CERTIFY THE SAME
   55  TO THE RESPECTIVE BOARDS OF EDUCATION  OR  THE  TRUSTEES  OF  EACH  SUCH
   56  DISTRICT.

       A. 3911                             3

    1    S  80. CERTIFICATION AND LEVY OF SCHOOL TAX. THE BOARD OF EDUCATION OR
    2  THE TRUSTEES OF EACH SCHOOL DISTRICT SHALL THEREUPON AND  ON  OR  BEFORE
    3  SEPTEMBER  FIFTEENTH  IN  THE  YEAR TWO THOUSAND TWELVE AND ON OR BEFORE
    4  AUGUST FIRST IN ALL SUCCEEDING YEARS, UPON THE TOTAL ASSESSED  VALUATION
    5  OF THE TAXABLE PROPERTY WITHIN THEIR SCHOOL DISTRICT AS CERTIFIED BY THE
    6  BOARD  OF  ASSESSORS  IN  THE  CURRENT  YEAR  AS  HEREINBEFORE PROVIDED,
    7  COMPUTE, ASCERTAIN AND  ADOPT  THE  TAX  RATE  PER  HUNDRED  DOLLARS  OF
    8  ASSESSED  VALUATION  NECESSARY  TO  RAISE  THE  AMOUNT REQUIRED FOR SAID
    9  DISTRICT FOR THE AMOUNT OF  THE  BUDGET  AND  FOR  ALL  OTHER  NECESSARY
   10  AMOUNTS  TO  BE RAISED BY TAXATION AS PROVIDED BY LAW, AND SHALL CERTIFY
   11  SAID RATE AND THE TOTAL AMOUNTS TO BE RAISED THEREBY TO  THE  SUPERVISOR
   12  OF THE TOWN.
   13    S  81.  LIEN, PAYMENT AND PENALTY. ALL SCHOOL TAXES UPON REAL PROPERTY
   14  SHALL BECOME A LIEN AND BE DUE AND PAYABLE ACCORDING TO THE SCHEDULE  IN
   15  SECTION  SEVENTY-EIGHT OF THIS ARTICLE, AND BE PAYABLE TO THE RESPECTIVE
   16  RECEIVERS OF TAXES UNTIL AND INCLUDING THE  SUCCEEDING  FORTY-FIRST  DAY
   17  AFTER THE PAYMENT IS DUE WITHOUT PENALTY. UNLESS PAYABLE IN TWO PAYMENTS
   18  AS  PROVIDED  BY  THIS ACT, ON TAXES REMAINING UNPAID ON THE FORTY-FIRST
   19  DAY AFTER THE PAYMENT IS DUE, INTEREST COMPUTED AT THE RATE AS  PROVIDED
   20  IN  SECTION  THIRTEEN-C OF THIS ACT. FROM THE FORTY-SECOND DAY AFTER THE
   21  PAYMENT IS DUE, SHALL BE ADDED FOR THE FIRST MONTH OR PART THEREOF,  AND
   22  FOR  EACH  MONTH  OR PART THEREOF THEREAFTER, UNTIL THE RETURN OF UNPAID
   23  TAXES IS MADE TO THE COUNTY TREASURER. THE RECEIVER SHALL REQUIRE DUPLI-
   24  CATE RECEIPTS FOR ALL PAYMENTS MADE BY HIM OR HER TO ANY  OTHER  OFFICER
   25  THAN  THE  COUNTY  TREASURER, AND SHALL FILE ONE OF SUCH DUPLICATES WITH
   26  THE COUNTY TREASURER ON MAKING HIS OR HER RETURN.
   27    S 82. AUTHORIZATION FOR TWO PAYMENTS OF TAXES.  NOT  LATER  THAN  JUNE
   28  FIFTEENTH  IN  ANY  YEAR,  THE TOWN BOARD OF ANY TOWN MAY ADOPT A RESOL-
   29  UTION, WHICH SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A PERMISSIVE REFERENDUM AS  HEREINAFTER
   30  PROVIDED; THAT AFTER THE NEXT SUCCEEDING DUE DATE AS OUTLINED IN SECTION
   31  SEVENTY-EIGHT  OF  THIS ARTICLE ALL SCHOOL TAXES UPON REAL ESTATE IN THE
   32  TAX ROLL SHALL BE DUE AND PAYABLE AND SHALL BE AND BECOME LIENS  ON  THE
   33  REAL ESTATE AFFECTED THEREBY, AND SHALL BE CONSTRUED AS AND DEEMED TO BE
   34  CHARGES  THEREON  ON  THE FORTY-SECOND DAY AFTER PAYMENT IS DUE, AND NOT
   35  EARLIER, AND SHALL REMAIN SUCH LIENS UNTIL  PAID.    PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,
   36  THAT  THERE SHALL BE NO PENALTY IF ONE-HALF OF ALL SUCH SCHOOL TAXES ARE
   37  PAID TO THE RECEIVER ON OR BEFORE  THE  FIFTEENTH  OF  OCTOBER  AND  THE
   38  SECOND  ONE-HALF OF ALL SUCH TAXES ARE PAID TO THE RECEIVER ON OR BEFORE
   39  THE SUCCEEDING THIRTY-FIRST DAY OF MARCH. WHERE  AUTHORIZATION  FOR  TWO
   40  PAYMENTS  OF  SCHOOL  TAXES  IS AUTHORIZED TAXPAYERS SHALL REMIT PAYMENT
   41  ACCORDING TO THE SCHEDULE OUTLINED IN THIS SECTION AND THE PROVISIONS OF
   42  SECTION SEVENTY-EIGHT OF THIS ARTICLE SHALL NOT CONTROL.   ON  ALL  SUCH
   43  FIRST  ONE-HALF OF SCHOOL TAXES UPON REAL ESTATE REMAINING UNPAID ON THE
   44  FIFTEENTH OF NOVEMBER, ONE PER CENTUM OF THE AMOUNT OF THE SAID ONE-HALF
   45  OF THE TAX WILL BE ADDED, AND AN ADDITIONAL ONE PER CENTUM OF THE AMOUNT
   46  OF THE SAID ONE-HALF OF THE TAX WILL BE ADDED, AND AN ADDITIONAL ONE PER
   47  CENTUM WILL BE ADDED FOR EACH MONTH OR PART  THEREOF  THEREAFTER,  UNTIL
   48  THE  RETURN  OF THE WARRANT TO THE COUNTY TREASURER. THE SECOND ONE-HALF
   49  OF THE SCHOOL TAX ON REAL ESTATE MAY BE  PAID  WITHOUT  PENALTY  ON  THE
   50  TENTH  DAY  OF  OR AT ANY TIME THEREAFTER, UNTIL, BUT NOT INCLUDING, THE
   51  SUCCEEDING APRIL FIRST, PROVIDING THE FIRST ONE-HALF OF SUCH  TAX  SHALL
   52  HAVE BEEN PAID OR SHALL BE PAID AT THE SAME TIME. THE WARRANT ANNEXED TO
   53  THE TAX ROLL OF ANY TOWN ADOPTING SUCH PROPOSITION AND IN WHICH TAXES ON
   54  REAL  ESTATE ARE PAYABLE IN INSTALLMENTS SHALL BE MADE TO CONFORM TO THE
   55  PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.  ANY  SUCH  RESOLUTION  OF  THE  TOWN  BOARD
   56  PROVIDING  FOR  THE  COLLECTION  OF TAXES IN INSTALLMENTS SHALL NOT TAKE

    1  EFFECT UNTIL THIRTY DAYS AFTER ITS ADOPTION; NOR UNTIL APPROVED  BY  THE
    2  AFFIRMATIVE  VOTE  OF  A MAJORITY OF THE QUALIFIED ELECTORS OF SUCH TOWN
    3  VOTING UPON A PROPOSITION THEREFOR, IF  WITHIN  THIRTY  DAYS  AFTER  ITS
    4  ADOPTION  THERE  BE  FILED WITH THE TOWN CLERK A PETITION SUBSCRIBED AND
    5  ACKNOWLEDGED AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLE SEVEN OF THE TOWN LAW  WITH  RESPECT
    6  TO  THE  SUBMISSION  OF  A  REFERENDUM  ON PETITION. IF A PETITION BE SO
    7  FILED, A PROPOSITION FOR  THE  APPROVAL  OF  SUCH  RESOLUTION  SHALL  BE
    8  SUBMITTED AT A GENERAL OR SPECIAL TOWN ELECTION TO BE HELD NOT MORE THAN
    9  FORTY  DAYS  AFTER  THE  FILING OF SUCH PETITION. NOTICE OF THE ELECTION
   10  SHALL BE GIVEN, SUCH ELECTION HELD AND THE VOTES  CANVASSED  AND  RESULT
   11  CERTIFIED  AND  RETURNED IN THE MANNER PROVIDED BY THE TOWN LAW RELATING
   12  TO THE SUBMISSION OF QUESTIONS UPON TOWN  PROPOSITIONS.  NOTWITHSTANDING
   13  THE  PROVISIONS  OF ANY GENERAL OR SPECIAL LAW TO THE CONTRARY, THE TOWN
   14  BOARD OF ANY TOWN MAY, BY  RESOLUTION,  PROVIDE  FOR  SEPARATING  SCHOOL
   15  TAXES  FROM  ALL THE REMAINDER OF THE TAXES, TO BE COLLECTED PURSUANT TO
   16  THE PROVISIONS OF THE TAX WARRANT, ALSO PROVIDE FOR THE  COLLECTION  AND
   17  PAYMENT  BY  THE  TAXPAYERS  OF  THEIR SCHOOL TAXES AT ONE TIME, AND THE
   18  COLLECTION AND PAYMENT OF ALL THE REMAINDER OF THE TAXES TO BE COLLECTED
   19  PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE TAX WARRANT, AT ANOTHER TIME OR TIMES,
   20  AND FURTHER PROVIDED THAT  SEPARATE  BILLS  BE  ISSUED  AND  MAILED  AND
   21  RECEIPTS  GIVEN  FOR  PAYMENT  OF  SCHOOL  TAXES  AS WELL AS FOR ALL THE
   22  REMAINDER OF THE TAXES TO BE COLLECTED PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE
   23  TAX WARRANT.
   24    S 6. This act shall take effect January 31, 2012.
